quest.name: Love Is a Battleground
journal:
Lisette would send you across the realm to bring succor to those lost in love.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

Summoning the divine powers of her ancestors, Lady Lisette has ascertained that a pirate lass only a stone's throw from the festival square in Limsa Lominsa has an uneasy heart on this Valentione's Day. Speak with O'kalkaya and see what troubles her.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

O'kalkaya of the Sanguine Sirens is concerned for Captain Rhoswen, who she suspects is preparing in secret for a fateful confrontation with the Kraken's Arms, the Sirens' longtime archrivals. Speak with Guildmaster Lyngsath at the Bismarck, which Rhoswen has been frequenting often in recent days.
Lyngsath is reluctant to share Rhoswen's secrets, offering only a cryptic comment that whatever the two are preparing, it is sure to cause sparks. Deliver this somewhat concerning news to O'kalkaya.

Your report strikes fear into O'kalkaya, who is now convinced that her captain is preparing firesand for a showdown with the Krakens. No sooner does she voice this concern, however, than she realizes that a Kraken deckhand has overheard the entire conversation. She bids you go in pursuit of the man.
The Kraken deckhand smugly informs you that he has already relayed what he overheard to his captain, who would speak with you about the matter. Seek out Carvallain at the Seventh Sage.

It would appear that O'kalkaya's concerns were not unfounded, as Carvallain reveals that Rhoswen has challenged him to a duel. Suspecting that the Siren has some underhanded scheme up her sleeve, he insists that you serve as witness to ensure a fair fight. Travel to the designated location ahead of Carvallain to put a preemptive stop to any foul play.

You are not entirely sure whether you just witnessed a duel or a botched confession of love, but whatever it was, it is mercifully over, with only a single piece of Rhoswen's chocolate remaining in the aftermath. Return the captain's confection to her crewman O'kalkaya.

O'kalkaya is taken aback upon realizing the true meaning behind the challenge. To defend her captain's honor, she insists that you speak not a word of what has transpired, offering a small gift to buy your silence. One can only hope that Rhoswen's wounds do not cut too deep.
objectives: Speak with the Kraken's Arms deckhand.

dialogue.name: LISSETE
dialogue.text: Across the realm, hearts pine and yearn. How fare you in bringing them succor?

dialogue.name: LISSETE
dialogue.text: You know not where to look? Why did you not say so sooner!? By the powers vested in me by my ancestors, I shall divine for you the whereabouts of a heart in need!

dialogue.name: LISSETE
dialogue.text: What's this? Even strapping seawives are no strangers to pangs of the heart, 'twould seem. Yes, a young Siren by the name of O'kalkaya, not a stone's throw from where we stand, awaits you, though she is not like to speak willingly of her plight.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: If yer lookin' fer a place to wet yer whistle, scrag, I'd advise ye to turn tail an' run.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: ...Hm. A landlubber who can look a Sanguine Siren in the eye an' not flinch? Ye've got more guts than most, I'll give ye that.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: Look, I ain't the type to warm to strangers, but I'm comin' to the end of me rope. Perhaps ye can do me a favor?

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: It's our cap'n, y'see. She's in a foul mood of late─fouler even than usual, which is sayin' quite a bit.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: What's more, she's been sneakin' about late at night, and to the Bismarck of all places. Call it sailor's intuition, but sure as the tide, I swear there's somethin' amiss... Could a showdown with those bloody Krakens be a-brewin'?

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: The cap'n's a tough mistress, but she's always been there for us, and I'll not abandon 'er in a time of need. Ye'll investigate for me, won't ye? Lyngsath should be able to tell ye a thing or two.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Cap'n Rhoswen? Aye, she was 'ere the other night. What's it to ye?

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: What sort o' chef would I be if I went about blabbin' me customers' secrets to any swab who walked through these doors, eh? Aye, a dead one, like as not. So let's just say she's asked me to whip up somethin' that's sure to make some sparks! Hah hah!

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: “Sparks,” 'e said!? Aye, that can mean only one thing─firesand. No doubt a showdown with those low-down Krakens is close at hand. But why the Bismarck? To hide the explosives from our foe's wanderin' eyes, ye reckon?

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: Hm!?

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: Blast! That Kraken spy 'eard everything! Quick, after the scurvy dog!

dialogue.name: KANPAN
dialogue.text: You're a bell late and a million gil short, landlubber. I've already told the captain everything I heard.

dialogue.name: KANPAN
dialogue.text: ...Not that I needed to. Yes, the schemings of those uncultured Sirens are as easy to read as the stars in the sky.

dialogue.name: KANPAN
dialogue.text: You've got some nerve showing yourself here after befriending that bunch. Fortunately for you, we Krakens are a more civilized lot, aye.

dialogue.name: KANPAN
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the captain has expressed a desire for a parley with you. If you're wise, you'll not keep him waiting long.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Welcome. You're a brave womanman indeed to come here. But fear not─I wish only to talk.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: You consort with the Sanguine Sirens, yes? I doubt I need tell you that the feud between Kraken and Siren is an old one, dating back to the years before we united under the Admiral's flag.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Just yesterday, a missive from Captain Rhoswen was delivered to me, challenging me to a duel. It would appear that my rival has at long last summoned the courage to settle the score between us. Needless to say, I welcome the challenge, but I will stand for no less than an honest fight.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: As an adventurer, you are not beholden to either crew. I would ask that you serve as witness to the duel. The place is the Anchor Yard, and the hour...is almost nigh. Hurry there to ensure my opponent plots no treachery, and I shall follow promptly.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: The Siren does not show? No doubt she has come to realize that she is hopelessly overmatched. Victory by default is hardly as satisfying, but it is victory nonetheless.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Save yer godsdamned blabberin' for when the battle is done...if ye've still got a mouth to speak with, that is.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: That said, I do give ye credit─I reckoned ye'd be too much of a scurvy coward to even show yer face.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Hah! I fear you vastly overestimate your own capacity for intimidation. Why, I would have challenged you sooner if I did not fear for the repercussions on your delicate heart.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: Delicate!? I've been ready for this day since ye were sucklin' at yer mum's teat!

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: ...Ever the songstress. Doubtless 'tis your silver tongue that earned you the name of Siren, yes? But enough talk─have at you!

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: What in the─!?

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: This ambrosial aroma. This couldn't possibly be...chocolate!?

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: B-Bloody ridiculous! You watch yer tongue, or I'll rip it from yer throat!

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. Distract me with your feminine wiles, and then strike when my guard is down? I fear your feeble ruse will not avail you today. I prefer my ladies a bit more...refined, you see.

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: R-Refined!? Bah, 'ave it yer way!

dialogue.name: RHOSWEN
dialogue.text: No woman in 'er right mind would fall for a puffy-shirted fop like you, anyway! What in the seven 'ells was I even thinkin'!?

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. I am not entirely certain what just transpired, but what I do know is that this has been a dreadful waste of my valuable time.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: As witness to the duel, I ask that you see to the disposal of that suspicious substance in my stead. It simply will not do to leave such hazardous materials lying about.

dialogue.name: CARVALLAIN
dialogue.text: I suggest you return it to the Sirens responsible for its creation. If not that vulgar Rhoswen herself, then one of her lackeys. Now, if you will excuse me, more important matters demand my attention.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: I thought ye'd never return! Whatever 'appened at the duel? The cap'n just returned, and I 'aven't seen 'er seethe like this in ages!

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: Eh? What's this ye 'ave 'ere? This is what the cap'n got from the Bismarck? The smell ain't like any firesand I've...

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: ...Oho! So that's what ol' Lyngsath meant when 'e spoke of makin' sparks.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: After all these years on 'er crew, I thought I knew the cap'n, but it'd seem she still 'ides a secret or two up 'er sleeve.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: If ye value yer tongue, ye'll not speak a word of this about town. We Sirens 'ave a reputation to protect, aye.

dialogue.name: OKALKAYA
dialogue.text: 'Ere, take this for yer troubles. Now if ye'll excuse me, I reckon the cap'n's lookin' for someone with whom to drown 'er sorrows.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have successfully assisted House Valentione in spreading love to all three city–states.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Return to the festival square in Limsa Lominsa and inform Lisette de Valentione that you have done your duty.
